Description: Handle zone and lower body sherds (two separate large fragments mended from nine fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with handle root; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black, much lost; four pairs of added white bands above frieze of lotus buds in white outline with added red centres and a further pair of white bands with red dots in between; exterior: at top of sherd, trace of filling ornament in lip frieze, possibly a rising triangle; below, two dilte lines and handle zone pattern consisting of guilloche with red dots; frill pattern around handle root; below on cul, eight wide bands; incised inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Although Lemos does not discuss this sherd, it ought to belong to her Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1).
One may note how the slip was detached in places when the inscription was cut. b just joins c.
